| Origin                  = A group of Purifiers genetically imbued with blood from [[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Archangel]]'s wings, granting them wings similar to the metal ones grafted on his back by [[En Sabah Nur (Earth-616)|Apocalypse]]
| PlaceOfFormation        = Facility base on the Canada/United States border
| PlaceOfDissolution      = 
| Creators                = Chris Yost; Craig Kyle; Clayton Crain
| First                   = X-Force Vol 3 #4
| Last                    = X-Force Vol 3 #6

| HistoryText             = After [[Rahne Sinclair (Earth-616)|Wolfsbane]] had attacked [[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Angel]] under post-hypnotic suggestion and torn his wings from him, she returned the wings to the [[Purifiers (Earth-616)|Purifiers]]. 

The scientist [[Adam Harkins (Earth-616)|Adam Harkins]] managed to implant cells from the wings into a group of Purifiers who were to be used as an army (a "choir") of Archangels.{{r|X-Force Vol 3 #4}}

[[File:Warren Worthington III (Earth-616) and Choir (Earth-616) from X-Force Vol 3 6 0001.jpg|left|thumb|[[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Angel]] laying in the corpses of the Choir]]
They were used by [[Matthew Risman (Earth-616)|Matthew Risman]] to confront the majority of the Purifiers, led by [[Bastion (Earth-616)|Bastion]], as Risman didn't approved the use of [[Techno-organic Virus]] to revive the members of the [[Human Council (Earth-616)|Human Council]].{{r|X-Force Vol 3 #5}}

As they assaulted Bastion's headquarters and decimated the Purifiers, they were attacked and slaughtered by the original Archangel, who had regrown his wings and was driven into a frenzy, killing each and every member of the Choir with no mercy, before he passed out among their corpses.{{r|X-Force Vol 3 #6}}

| Equipment               = [[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Archangel]]'s wings and helmets.
| Transportation          = [[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Archangel]]'s wings.
| Weapons                 = [[Warren Worthington III (Earth-616)|Archangel]]'s wings were used as blades and projectiles, also spears.
